revised_title: Observations on the Structure and Growth of Callus in Hands and Feet
tldr: The author examines the callus, or hard skin, on hands and feet using a microscope and discovers that it is made up of numerous small particles. They observe that these particles are composed of even smaller, irregularly shaped structures. The author also notes that the skin on hands and feet is constantly shedding and regenerating these particles, which may be ingested when eating food prepared by hand.
